title: Describe how you prepare for a trip. What steps do you usually take?

korean: 다음 달에 부산 갈 계획인데, 요즘 여행 준비하느라 바빠.
먼저 KTX 표부터 예매했는데, 주말이라 자리가 별로 없더라고.
간신히 표 구하긴 했는데, 금액이 생각보다 비싸서 좀 아까워.
숙소는 해운대 쪽으로 알아보는 중인데, 가격대가 다양해서 고민돼.
바다 뷰가 있는 곳으로 하고 싶은데, 예산이 좀 넘을 것 같아.
여행 코스는 인터넷 블로그 보면서 참고하는 중이야.
감천문화마을이랑 해운대, 광안리는 꼭 가보고 싶어.
그리고 태종대도 추천을 많이 받아서 고려 중이야.
맛집 리스트도 만들고 있는데, 먹고 싶은 게 너무 많아.
친구가 자갈치시장도 가보라고 해서 일정에 넣었어.
짐 쌀 때 뭐 챙겨야 할지 리스트 작성 중인데, 빠뜨릴까 봐 걱정돼.
날씨도 체크해야 하는데, 비 올 확률이 있다고 해서 우산 챙겨야 할 것 같아.
여행 계획 세우는 것도 은근히 재미있어, 빨리 가고 싶다.
english: Well, I'm planning to go to Busan next month, and, like, I've been pretty busy preparing for the trip these days.
First, I booked KTX tickets, but since, you know, it's a weekend, there weren't many seats available.
I barely got tickets, but honestly, the price was more expensive than I thought, so it's kind of a waste.
I'm looking for accommodation around Haeundae, and there's a wide price range, so I'm really torn.
I want a place with an ocean view, but it seems like it'll probably go over budget.
So I'm planning my itinerary by looking at internet blogs for reference.
I mean, I definitely want to visit Gamcheon Culture Village, Haeundae, and Gwangalli.
And actually, I'm also considering Taejongdae because I got a lot of recommendations.
I'm also making a restaurant list, and there's literally so much I want to eat.
I must try milmyeon, pork soup, and seed hotteok.
My friend told me to check out Jagalchi Market too, so I added it to the itinerary.
When packing, I'm making a list of what to bring, and I'm worried I'll forget something.
I need to check the weather too, and they say there's, like, a chance of rain, so I think I should pack an umbrella.
Planning a trip is actually pretty fun, and I can't wait to go.
